Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of this peptide shows 49% similarity tolacticin Q. N-terminal Met is formylated. leaderless.Activity:Active against S. saprophyticus (MIC 82.3-160 nM), S. hominis (MIC 160 nM), S. warneri (MIC 160 nM), E. faecalis (MIC 160 nM), including multidrug-resistant S. epidermidis strains causing biofilm-related infections (MIC 10-658 nM), S. aureus 1195 MRSA (MIC 160-329 nM), and vancomycin-resistant enterococci anti-VRE (MIC 82.3-329 nM).Antimicrobial robustness: lysozyme, lipase, and alpha-amylase treatment did not cause activity loss, but proteinase k and trypsin caused 25-50% acitivity loss. pH-insensitive (pH 2-10). heat-stable aftwe 70oC treatment for 60 min.Structure: It contains four helices: I: 2-13; II: 15-25; III: 25-36; and IV: 38-51.You can rotate, zoom, and view the lipid II bound 3D structureherein the PDB.MOA:bacteria: it acts on bacterial membranes by forming pores (Hammond et al., 2020).Recombinant production:bacteria: It can be expressed in Escherichia coil BL21(DE3). The recombinant peptide shows activity against M. luteus and S. aureus strains in lawn assays.Toxicity: not hemo.lytic at 100 x MIC. At this concentration, not toxic to human dermal
